clinical_study.brief_title: DPP-4 Inhibition and TZD for DM Prevention
clinical_study.official_title: DPP-4 Inhibition and Thiazolidinedione for Diabetes Mellitus Prevention (DInT DM Study)

brief_summary.textblock: To determine whether treatment with the diabetes medication, Januvia (sitagliptin), with or without another diabetes medicine, Actos (pioglitazone), will improve insulin secretion and insulin response individuals with Impaired Glucose Tolerance (IGT), a form of prediabetes.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Unanticipated delays due to sterilization/stabilization testing of GLP-1.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 6 months, 9 months (after a 3 month washout)
primary_outcome.description: Not measured as study was prematurely terminated due to unanticipated delays.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Impaired glucose tolerance (IGT) by oral glucose tolerance test
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of diabetes mellitus
- History of congestive heart failure
- History of coronary artery disease or other macrovascular disease (stroke, peripheral vascular disease)
- History of liver disease (ALT or AST >2.5 times the upper limit of normals)
- History of renal disease (serum creatinine >1.5 mg/dl)
- History of severe osteoporosis (frequent fractures, failure on osteoporosis treatment)
- Current treatment with glucocorticoids
- History of immune disorder, including HIV
- Women of child-bearing age who are pregnant, desire to become pregnant, are breastfeeding, or who refuse to take the recommended birth control measures

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Only 3 control (normal glucose tolerance) subjects were enrolled to obtain results in normal subjects for the hyperglycemic clamp (without GLP-1 or arginine). No samples were run, and, therefore, there are no data for the control subjects. No subjects with impaired glucose tolerance (IGT) were recruited or enrolled in the study.
